intro: Carum brachyactis, commonly known as the short-lived caraway, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and small, white to pale purple flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent, similar to other members of its family. Carum brachyactis is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in regions with mild, Mediterranean climates.
